page.title: 09Farming: Dairy Farmer's Day
page.content: My dad is a dairy farmer. At 7.30 every morning he brings the cows into the collecting yard, starts the milking machine and runs hot water into buckets to clean the cows' udders. He lets the cows into the milking parlour 6 at a time, washes the udders, puts the clusters onto the udders and milks the cows. When they have been milked the cows have their udders washed with disinfectant to stop them getting diseases like mastitis. The cows must have calves to keep their milk yield up. During the day the cows are put out to graze and dad gets on with other jobs around the farm. At 6.30 in the evening the cows are brought in for their final milking before being turned out for the night. The milk is collected each day by a large tanker lorry.
